title: Most titles in a single season for FC Barcelona
body_text:
Most titles in a single season for FC Barcelona
- label.aria.viber Viber
- label.aria.whatsapp WhatsApp
- label.aria.twitter Twitter
- label.aria.facebook Facebook
- label.aria.messenger Messenger
- label.aria.link label.aria.tick Copy link
FC Barcelona is more than a club. For sure. It has to be to have achieved what is has done this year. For the first time ever, all six of its pro sports teams lifted the domestic league trophy. Handball, men's and women's football, roller hockey, basketball and as of Friday, the futsal championships too!
In total, the 19 trophies collected by those six teams is the biggest haul in club history, matching the tallies in 2011/12, 2014/15, 2017/18 and 2018/19.
Five football trophies
The men's football team not only won La Liga but also came back from Saudi Arabia with the Spanish Super Cup, having beaten Real Madrid in the final.
And as well as a fourth consecutive league title, the women also won their Spanish Super Cup, and also beat Wolfsburg to win the Champions League for the second time.
Five for basketball and roller hockey
The basketball started the season by winning the Catalan league, and then went on to win the Spanish league, sweeping the final series against Real Madrid 3-0.
And the recently crowned roller hockey champions of Spain has previously emerged triumphant in the Copa del Rey and Spanish Super Cup to win a domestic treble.
Huge hauls for handball and futsal
The biggest amounts of silverware correspond to the handball and futsal teams. The handball team won five. In addition to a 13th consecutive league title, they also won the Copa del Rey, Copa ASOBAL, Spanish Super Cup and the first ever Inberian Super Cup, in which they beat Oporto in the final.
The futsal team complete the trophy collection. The final title of the season was the league, conquered with a 3-0 demolition of Jaen in the final. But Jes√∫s Velasco also guided the team to victory in the Copa del Rey, Spanish Super Cup and Copa Catalunya.
The FC barcelona museum is fuller than ever after all that lot. What a season!
